item.title: 尽管市场繁荣，日本全球银行的奖金却在缩水

item.title: 华尔街涨势受阻，亚洲交易员态度谨慎：市场综述

item.title: 瑞波公司的加林豪斯称美国证券交易委员会将在加密货币案中索赔 20 亿美元

item.title: 佛罗里达州高速铁路向投资者发出再融资邀请

item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的新兴媒体公司上市时，一些空头支票公司的投资者自愿退出交易，损失了 75%。【原文：Some investors in the blank-check firm taking Donald Trump’s nascent media company public voluntarily took a 75% loss by pulling out of the deal.】

item.title: Pemex 详细介绍重大环境、社会和公司治理计划，投资者等待结果
item.description: 墨西哥国营石油公司周一制定了一项计划，将大幅减少排放、提高安全标准并投资于新的绿色技术，但 ESG 投资者表示，他们可能需要看到结果，才能向这家负债累累的公司注入更多资金。【原文：Mexico’s state oil company laid out a plan Monday to drastically cut emissions, improve safety standards and invest in new green technologies, but ESG investors say they may need to see results before infusing more capital in the debt-saddled company.】

item.title: 就在美国人上路之际，夏季油泵价格将达到每加仑 4 美元
item.description: 据美国汽车协会（AAA）汽车俱乐部称，随着石油在供应担忧中上涨，美国今年夏天的油价将攀升至 2022 年夏天以来的最高点，达到每加仑 4 美元。【原文：Pump prices this US summer are set to climb to the highest since the summer of 2022 — to $4 a gallon — as oil rises amid supply concerns, according to the AAA automobile club.】

item.title: 底特律在破产十年后获得投资级评级
item.description: 曾经破产的底特律在穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）上调评级后首次获得了投资级评级，这标志着这座长期与高失业率和高贫困率作斗争的城市迈出了重要一步。【原文：Once-bankrupt Detroit has won its first investment-grade rating after an upgrade by Moody’s Ratings, marking a major step for the city, which has long struggled with high unemployment and elevated poverty rates.】

item.title: 据说 Advent 将出售 Idemia Identity 部门，以寻求新的出路
item.description: 据知情人士透露，收购公司 Advent International 正在寻求出售 Idemia 公司的欧洲身份验证业务，作为分拆计划的一部分，这家法国生物识别公司的三个部门将分别出售。【原文：Buyout firm Advent International is looking to sell the European identity authentication business of Idemia as part of a breakup plan that will see each of the French biometrics company’s three units being sold separately, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 特朗普的社交媒体公司将于周二在纳斯达克交易
item.description: 前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的社交媒体初创公司在完成一笔空白支票交易后，将于周二开始交易，这笔交易可能会给他带来一笔意外之财。【原文：Former president Donald Trump’s social media startup is set to begin trading Tuesday after completing a blank-check deal that may bring him a financial windfall.】

item.title: 可可危机加深，加纳将失去获得银行贷款的机会
item.description: 由于可可作物的危机，加纳没有足够的可可豆来获得资金，因此加纳将失去获得关键融资机制的机会。【原文：Ghana is set to lose access to a key funding facility as a crisis in its cocoa crop has left it without enough beans to secure the funds.】

item.title: 美联储着眼于长期提高利率，垃圾股市场发出警告
item.description: 在美联储的加息行动之后，评级为垃圾级的美国公司的利息成本上升，但利润却没有跟上，这对财务状况造成了压力，也凸显了在这种趋势持续的情况下，高收益债券投资者面临的一个主要风险。【原文：Junk-rated US companies have seen their interest costs rise after the Federal Reserve’s rate-hike campaign, but profits haven’t kept up, putting a squeeze on finances and underscoring a key risk for investors in high-yield debt as the trend persists.】

item.title: 乌克兰认为欧盟谷物辩论更多涉及政治而非贸易
item.description: 乌克兰农业部长表示，几个欧盟成员国推动限制从乌克兰进口谷物是出于政治动机，而不是这些国家政府的经济问题。【原文：A push by several European Union member states to limit the import of grain from Ukraine is politically motivated and not an economic problem for those governments, the country’s agriculture minister said.】

item.title: 美国糖业寻求遏制墨西哥进口

item.description: 欧洲最大的收债公司之一 Intrum AB 表示，将在未来几周内启动与债权人的谈判，以设法管理其债务负担。【原文：One of Europe’s biggest debt collectors, Intrum AB, said talks with creditors will kick off in the coming weeks as it seeks to manage its debt burden.】

item.title: 垃圾股发行人急于再融资，利差为 2022 年以来最低

item.title: 麦格理称，随着成本下降，美国石油产量将增至创纪录水平
item.description: 麦格理集团（Macquarie Group Ltd.）分析师在一份报告中说，由于成本下降和钻井效率的提高盖过了上市公司低迷的增长计划，美国石油产量将在今年年底达到创纪录的每天约 1400 万桶。【原文：US oil production is set to end the year at a record pace of about 14 million barrels a day as falling costs and improved drilling efficiency overshadow subdued growth plans from publicly listed companies, Macquarie Group Ltd. analysts said in a note.】

item.title: 美联储库克强调对降息采取 "谨慎 "态度的必要性
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）表示，美国央行必须对降息采取谨慎态度，以便留出更多时间让部分经济领域的通胀放缓。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook said the US central bank must take a cautious approach to cutting interest rates to allow more time for inflation to slow down in some segments of the economy.】
